titleStmt.title: The life of Mr. Thomas Firmin, late citizen of London written by one of his most intimate acquaintance ; with a sermon on Luke X. 36, 37 preach'd on the occasion of his death ; together with An account of his religion, and of the present state of the Unitarian controversy.
titleStmt.author: One of his most intimate acquaintance.

titleStmt.title: The life of Mr. Thomas Firmin, late citizen of London written by one of his most intimate acquaintance ; with a sermon on Luke X. 36, 37 preach'd on the occasion of his death ; together with An account of his religion, and of the present state of the Unitarian controversy.
titleStmt.author: One of his most intimate acquaintance.
Nye, Stephen, 1648?-1719.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, and sold by A. Baldwin,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Stephen Nye. Cf. McAlpin Coll.
Imperfect: "A sermon on Luke X. 36, 37" and "An account of Mr. Firmin's religion, and of the present state of the Unitarian controversy" lacking on filmed copy.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
